titleInfo.title: Staying the course : reflections on 40 years of grantmaking at the Rockefeller Brothers Fund.

mods.abstract: As a scientist often seeking funding for research, an opportunity to understand the workings of funding agencies - why, how, who they choose to fund and what they want in return, drew me to this new publication. The text answers all these questions both as a first person account of 40 years of grant making, but also in a more traditionally didactic section on the dos and don'ts. Not only is the book's style very readable, but providing personal perspective to the various activities of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund efforts gives life to the topic which would fail to be apparent in a more academic approach.
